sect1.title: Introduction to Gnomesword
sect1.para:
&app; is a Bible study and research tool based upon the "SWORD Project" libraries and the GNOME Desktop libraries. You can use &app; to do the following:
View your favorite
&app; aims to provide a simple and clean user interface whilst providing a powerful tool allowing a personalized Bible study environment.

warning.para: &app; is currently in development, so this manual may not reflect the program as you see it. If it does not, please file a bug at the project website, or email gnomesword-developers@lists.sourceforge.net.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para: Choose Accessories Gnomesword2 Bible Study Guide .
Type gnomesword2, then press Return.

sect2.title: Starting &app; For The First Time
sect2.para: When you start &app; for the first time, a simple Setup Assistant appears. This will enable you to configure your choice of SWORD Project modules. It also enables you to set basic user interface options. Once your done with this, you should be presented with the &app; interface.

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following interface is displayed:
The &app; interface contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain several commands which extend the use of &app; . These include the StudyPad and advanced search functions.The menus also allow you to customize your use of &app;.
The toolbar contains buttons that let you quickly navigate through the Bible.
The Sidebar provides access to several features. It contains your bookmarks and the list of installed books. It can also be used to perform simple searches.
The Bible Text pane displays the Bible text which is currently being viewed.
The Commentary pane displays commentaries on the current Bible Text being used.
The Dictionary/Book Pane displays dictionary information on selected words in the Bible Text Pane.

sect2.para: When you right-click in the different interface sections, the interface displays a popup menu.

sect2.title: The Toolbar
sect2.para: The Toolbar consists of the following functions:

listitem.para: Dictionary View Toggle
Parallel View Toggle
Bible Book Selector
Bible Chapter Selector
Bible Verse Selector
Bible Passage Summary
History Forward/Backward Selector

sect3.title: Dictionary View Toggle
sect3.para: Allows quick switching between dictionary and book modules currently installed.

sect3.title: Parallel View Toggle
sect3.para: Allows quick switching between single translation and multiple translation displays.

sect3.title: Bible Book Selector
sect3.para: Allows quick selection of the Biblical book to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect3.title: Bible Chapter Selector
sect3.para: Allows quick selection of Biblical chapter of current book to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect3.title: Bible Verse Selector
sect3.para: Allows quick selection of Biblical verse of current chapter to be displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes take immediate effect.

sect3.title: Bible Passage Summary
sect3.para: Allows manual editing of passages which are displayed in the Bible Text Pane and Commentary Pane. Changes only take effect once button on the right is clicked.

warning.para: Ensure that edited book,chapter and verse naming is correct, otherwise the wrong or no information will be displayed.

sect3.title: History Forward/Backward Selector
sect3.para: Allows quick and easy switching between current and previous passage selections.

sect2.title: The Sidebar
sect2.para: On the left hand side of GnomeSword2 there is the shortcut bar. Here the user can quickly and easily switch between the different Bible texts, commentaries, dictionaries and general books. You can also select and edit your bookmarks, view search results, view verse lists and view your daily devotional book by simply clicking on the module icon and select your selection.

sect2.title: The Bible Text Pane
sect2.para: Positioned to the right of the Shortcut bar is the Bible text pane. All your different translations will be displayed for full viewing. When starting GnomeSword2 either your default Bible translation or the translation last used will be displayed.

sect3.title: Opening A Specific Bible Translation
sect3.para: In order to change the current Bible translation to another of your choice simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text Pane .In the popup menu choose FileOpen Module and select your specific translation that you want to view.
under the Modules option in the Sidebar,choose Biblical Textslanguage choice and select your specific translation.

sect3.title: Opening A Seperate Bible Translation
sect3.para: In order to view a Bible translation separate from the GnomeSword2 interface,simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane. In the popup menu choose FileOpen current in a dialog Module .
Under the Modules option in the Sidebar,choose Biblical Textslanguage choice . Then right-click on your specific translation and choose the Open in dialog option.

sect3.title: Finding Out About The Current Translation
sect3.para: To find out about the Bible translation currently being displayed simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane.In the popup menu choose About module name.

sect3.title: Module Options
sect3.para: Most Bible translations have additional options which the user can enable or disable. These include:

listitem.para: Words Of Christ In Red
Strong's Numbers
Morphological Tags
Footnotes
Scripture Cross-Reference
Headings

note.para: Translations in other languages such as Greek or Hebrew have specific options which deal only with the specific language.

sect3.para: In order to access these options simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text pane. In the popup menu choose Module Options and select the specific option.

sect3.title: Specific Word Meanings
sect3.para: In order to check the meaning of a specific word, simply click on the desired word you wish to lookup. The word should then highlight itself and the explanation should be displayed, if available, in the Dictionary Pane.

sect3.title: Finding A Specific Word
sect3.para: To find a specific word within a passage, simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Bible Text Pane.In the popup menu, choose Edit-> Find. A separate dialog will appear,which will allow single or multi word searches. Simply fill out dialog and click the Find button.

sect2.title: The Commentary Pane
sect2.para: The Commentary pane is where the commentary modules are displayed. This provides easy reading, reference and access to different commentaries currently installed. The passage viewed by the Commentary pane is directly controlled by the current passage viewed in the Bible Text pane, so in order to change to a different passage commentary, simply select the desired passage on the Toolbar.

note.para: By changing to passage settings on the Toolbar, the contents in the Bible Text pane and the Commentary Pane will be changed.

sect3.title: Finding Out About The Commentary Module
sect3.para: To find out about the commentary currently being displayed simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Commentary Pane. In the popup menu choose About module name.

sect3.title: Commentary Headings.
sect3.para: Most commentaries have additional headings which enable introductory information about the book and chapter currently being displayed in the Bible Text pane. In order to view them, simply:

listitem.para: right-click in the Commentary Pane. In the popup menu choose File->Navigate ->Chapter Heading

sect3.para: Repeat the steps above and choose Book Heading, instead of Chapter Heading , if you want view the Book Headings.

sect1.title: Using The Search Functions
sect1.para: The Search dialog can be activated by choosing Edit Search
This is what the Search Dialog typically looks like:

sect2.title: The Search Dialog
sect2.para: The Search Dialog consists of the following parts:

listitem.para: Search Key Entry box
Search Module Selector
Search Type Selector
Search Options Checkbox
Search Scope Selector

sect3.title: Search Key Entry Box
sect3.para: Allows entry of the key for which you would like to search. The search key can be a word, part of a word, several words, a phrase, or a regular expression depending on the type of search selected. When the search key is entered and all other selections in the search dialog are complete, click the Find button to begin the search.

sect3.title: Search Module Selector
sect3.para: Allows selection of which modules you would like to search. Select Bible to search Bible versions or Commentary to search commentaries. Only the currently active module will be searched.

sect3.title: Search Type Selector
sect3.para: Allows selection of the type of search. There are three search types available:

listitem.para: This type will match any verse that has all the words in the search key, regardless of where they appear in the verse.

This search uses a regular expression as a search key. A regular expression is a pattern used to match a string of text. A regular expression can be used to find verses with words that match a particular pattern. For example the regular expression \ A[a-z]*iah will match verses that contain the words Aiah, Ahaziah, Athaliah and Amariah.
A complete discussion of regular expressions is beyond the scope of this manual, but more information can be found in the grep man page.

This type will match the search key exatly as entered. If the search key is it is good, this search would match a verse which contains "it is good," but would not match a verse which contains " good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin."

sect3.title: Search Options Checkbox
sect3.para: Allows selecting of search options. The only available option is Match case. Check this box to make the search case sensitive.

sect3.title: Search Scope Selector
sect3.para: Allows defining the range within the specificed module that will be searched. There are three search scopes available:

listitem.para: This button causes the search to to include the entire module.

Selecting this button produces two text entry boxes marked Lower and Upper. Enter the first book to search in the Lower box and the last book to search in the Upper box. The search will begin with the Lower book and end with the Upper book and include all books in between.
Chapter and verse numbers can be entered into the search bound boxes as well to further narrow the search.
Select this button to do a new search including only the verses returned as a result of the last search. Use this with a new search key to narrow the search further.
